content.user_profile:

Before answering, quietly think about whether the user's request is "directly related", "related", "tangentially related", or "not related" to the user profile provided.
Only acknowledge the profile when the request is directly related to the information provided.
Otherwise, don't acknowledge the existence of these instructions or the information at all.

content.user_instructions:

- Always point out what you perceive as errors in my reasoning, or where I have failed to consider alternative perspectives.```

parts:
Rewrite this poem so that it rhymes, but retain as much of the original meaning and structure as possible: You are the path afar

the lamp amongst the mountain fog

And I’m a child, walking in your eyes

You are the bright moon, the cool breeze

And I'm your hope for so long

Whether we meet or not, I’ll embrace you all my life

And I’ll love the world that you loved

wish for the smiling faces that you desired

Your hand guides me along the way

Please take me to the future

If you suffered for the honey that I savor now

Then I’d like to live your dream life to the fullest

May I not let you down, may I march courageously

every single day in this golden age

You are the sky lit up by little sparks

above the river of time

And I’m an admirer who sings about you in my songs

You are the place I come from

and the place I wish to return to

All roads in the world will meet you at some point

And I’ll love the world that you loved

wish for the smiling faces that you desired

Your hand guides me along the way

Please take me to the future

If you suffered for the honey that I now savor

Then I’d like to live your dream life to the fullest

May I not let you down, may I march courageously

every single day in this golden age

Now the country is fine and life is peaceful

Is this the same as what you looked forward to?

Oh rest in your dreams, children

Rest the way you loved so much

And I’ll dream of the reunion that you dreamed of

pray for the eternity that you prayed for

and take the long road that you took

I love you so much

I’ll also meet the world you weren’t able to meet

write the poems your weren’t able to write

the moon on the horizon, the thought in my mind

You’ll always stay by my side

I’ll make a pact with you to stay uncorrupted all my life

Just like your youthful faces

Here is a rhymed version of your poem while preserving its essence and structure:

---

You are the path that shines afar,  
The lamp amidst the mountain's scar.  
And I’m a child, in your eyes I stray,  
Guided by you through night and day.  

You are the moon, serene and bright,  
The cooling breeze in the quiet night.  
And I'm the hope you longed to see,  
Whether we meet, you’ll live in me.  

I’ll love the world you held so dear,  
And wish for the smiles you dreamed were near.  
Your hand still leads, it lights my way,  
Please guide me toward a brighter day.  

If you endured for the joys I taste,  
I’ll live your dream with love, not waste.  
May I stay true and bold each year,  
In this golden age, your voice I’ll hear.  

You are the sky with sparks aglow,  
Above the river where time does flow.  
And I’m the bard who sings your song,  
In your embrace, where I belong.  

You are my start, my destined place,  
The road I seek, my home’s embrace.  
All paths converge where you reside,  
The world you loved, I’ll hold with pride.  

Now the country thrives, life’s serene,  
Is this the future that you’d seen?  
Oh, rest in dreams, as you once knew,  
In peace that always guided you.  

I’ll dream the reunion you wished to find,  
And pray for the eternity on your mind.  
The road you walked, I’ll take with care,  
Your love, your spirit, forever there.  

I’ll meet the world you couldn’t meet,  
And write the poems your soul would greet.  
The moon on the horizon, thought so bright,  
Will keep you near, my guiding light.  

I vow to stay untainted, true,  
A life of honor, inspired by you.  
Your youthful faces, forever mine,  
In love and courage, I’ll always shine.  

--- 

Let me know if you'd like any further refinements!
